positionName: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI
location: 610 Newport Center Dr, Newport Beach, CA
description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI (21031738)
Description
THE OPPORTUNITY
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst rock star to join our team who is highly passionate about leveraging technology to extract and share analytics insights using creative data visualizations. The individual will be self-motivated and results-oriented with the ability to work independently, juggle multiple tasks, prioritize workload, and adhere to tight deadlines within a collaborative team environment.
The ideal candidate will weave together disparate data, derive insights, and build a compelling story to drive action. They can work at a strategic level, helping to shape the team's roadmap but will not shy away from tactical tasks driving the best solutions and the team's mission. Responsible for the design, development, implementation, and support of mission-critical enterprise Business Intelligence solutions using Power BI sourcing data from many disparate sources. Additionally, this role will mine and analyze data that support key business initiatives and business insights deep dives.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
In addition to following Chipotle's policies and procedures, principal accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
Collaborate with other BI Analysts and Engineers around data/table structures to optimize for Dashboards and different self-service needs.
Trusted to work independently with stakeholders at all levels
Support peers and stakeholders as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) through troubleshooting, analysis of results. Act as mentor and Power BI SME for other Power BI users across the company.
Look for opportunities to improve current processes or find efficiencies by applying industry best practices as a BI analyst
Commitment to maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction through the implementation, investigation, analysis, training, and relationship-building efforts
WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE TABLE
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or related discipline.
Restaurant industry experience a plus
Extreme passion for using data to uncover insights and drive business performance
5+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques, and technology, our expertise in analytics, business analysis, or comparable consumer analytics solutions
5+ years of experience writing advanced SQL, performance tuning of BI queries, data modeling, and data mining from multiple sources (SQL, ETL, data warehousing).
3+ years of experience using business intelligence reporting tools. Mastery of Power BI for the creation and automation of Enterprise-Scale dashboards, standard reports, scorecards, and ad-hoc reports to provide critical business insights for an entire organization
Experience with advanced Power BI topics such as complex calculations, table calculations, parameters, geographic mapping, multiple disparate data sources, and performance optimization
Familiar with Data Visualization best practices
Experience in data mining, ETL, etc., and using databases in a business environment.
Build prototypes for demonstration and illustration purposes for peer groups, Business partners, or senior leaders.
Experience taking large volumes of data and condensing it into a clean, insightful, and automated format.
Outstanding ability to communicate and drive discussions on data and insights, context, and implications with business and technology partners. Documenting and communicating technical specifications to ensure that proper and optimized techniques, queries, and final deliverables are understood and incorporated into data and analytics processes
Attention to detail to ensure the highest level of quality/rigor in reports & analyses
Ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems logically and systematically
Highly flexible, with the ability to execute well in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving organization.
Potential remote work available
CULTIVATING A BETTER WORLD
Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast-food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.
WHO WE ARE
Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives. Chipotle had over 2,750 restaurants on December 31, 2020, in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France, and Germany. It is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. With nearly 88,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology, and sustainable business practices. Steve Ells, the founder, first opened Chipotle with a single restaurant in Denver, Colorado, in 1993. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM.

positionName: Business Analyst - Southern California News Group
description:
The Business Applications Analyst is responsible for support of local, Corporate installed, and cloud-hosted applications for core Advertising, Circulation, Editorial and Operations business areas. They will work within an interdisciplinary IT team that is involved in all areas of the system support lifecycle.
Essential Functions
 Provide high level application functionality for MediaNews Group (MNG) primary vendor installed and cloud-based production applications – Adbase.
Set-up new publications/products, product migrations and changes, user account set-ups and changes within Adbase.
Work between systems, whether a preexisting tool or creating a tool to communicate with Adbase and the other software to provide essential modifications, and maintenance for interface software’s.
Work within small applications that tie into a larger core system to monitor, troubleshoot, rewrite, and enhance the productivity of the applications, building out new applications as needed.
Employ cloud-based repositories to maintain version code control - maintaining programming code.
Create and maintain various financial business reports, including customer statements, sales reports, revenue reports and other report types as needed within Adbase.
Backend report writing using Crystal Reports
Liaison with MNG business units, including Finance, Project Management, Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), sales and circulation teams to provide IT project leadership and insights.
Competencies & Skills
BS in Computer Science or related education
5 years IT experience supporting large scale business applications and programming.
Expertise in all aspects of SQL Server
Experience with SQL Transaction Manager, Adbase or similar Advertising order entry systems, Crystal Report Writing, and Python, Java or Perl for interface writing between systems.
Basic understanding of XML files.
Knowledge of Windows software applications and Google Suite applications.
At least two years of experience working with financial reporting and accounting with knowledge of PCI rules and regulations, understanding of credit card authorization process.
Strong trouble-shooting skills across multiple systems, good communication and organization skills.
Proactive mindset with the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

location: 130 S State College Blvd, Brea, CA 92821
description:
Overview:

*May Consider Full Time Teleworking for this position.*
The Data Governance Lead is responsible for leading various data governance activities for the Data Governance Office at the Bank. The role reports directly to the Data Governance Officer for Pacific Western Bank and plays an important role in maturing the Bank’s enterprise data governance framework. This position will facilitate and lead the business outreach, proactive data profiling efforts, requirements gathering, and implementation of the automated data governance tools and processes to address the Bank’s data governance needs and drive tool adoption at the business unit level. The incumbent will be required to navigate effectively and support a matrixed team of data owners, data stewards, business users, IT with the adoption of the enterprise level centralized data governance tools and processes.
Responsibilities:
Lead business outreach and understand business process and pain points around critical data.
Perform proactive data profiling, technical data analysis, and review profiling results with the business to identify data quality rules for critical data.
Navigate effectively with business, data management and IT partners to understand the current data structures and processes impacting data with a focus on providing value to the business.
Play a key role in supporting Data Governance Officer with data governance tool evaluations, requirements development, tool implementation, Vendor selection and Proof of Concept (POC).
Co-ordinate and encourage cross functional collaboration and testing of self-service tools by business data stewards, owners and consumers.
Work with internal DG team to support requirements for data quality and reporting and analytics platform development for data governance initiatives.
Maintain central documentation around profiling, tool training and user guides.
Define and measure Key Performance Indicator’s for DG progress and the success of the program.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required:
Minimum of 8 years of overall industry experience.
Minimum of 4 years of hands on experience in SQL query, Oracle and SQL Server databases.
Minimum of 2 years of hands on experience working with data profiling and governance tools (e.g. Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Informatica Analyst profiling tool, and Informatica Exon/Collibra DG tool).
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance, or other relevant discipline.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of information management, data governance, data quality, data analysis and metadata management topics
Demonstrate a working knowledge of data architecture, structures and various data quality, governance and reporting & analytics platforms (e.g. Informatica IDQ, Axon, PowerBI).
Knowledge of industry leading data quality, data governance and data management processes.
Knowledge of data related regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues.
Proactive mindset with focus on providing value with thorough data analysis.
Excellent business acumen and time management skills.
Strong organizational, written and verbal communication skills with Influencing and Negotiating capabilities.
Positive with suggestions & flexible to adjust with the environment.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Ability to interface effectively and professionally with internal and cross functional teams.
Ability to multi-task several projects at once. Flexible and adaptable to change.
Self-motivated and excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Quick learner with willingness to learn new techniques & tools.
Well versed with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, MS Word, Visio and PowerPoint).
Strong ability in documenting procedures and user guides
Preferred:
2 years of experience in commercial bank or financial services firm.
2 years of experience in reporting and analytics tools – Power BI and/or Tableau.
Experience with Data Warehouse / Data Lake / MDM Hub concepts (Production/Aggregation/Consumption layers).
Project Management certification (PMP) is preferred.

Description
Ingram Micro is an integral part of the technology and commerce ecosystems, helping our partners grow and thrive through the creation and delivery of Information Technology, Lifecycle Management, e-Commerce Logistics, and Cloud solutions. With $49 billion in revenue and the ability to reach 90% of the global population, we have become the world’s largest technology distributor with operations in 59 countries and more than 35,000 associates.

Location: Williamsville, NY which was announced "one of the best places to work" for 2018
**Hybrid work schedule available**
SUMMARY:
This position is responsible for supporting the day to day operational processes and assist in design and development of logistics plans, recommendations for continuous improvement of the Ingram Micro-Logistics Operations team including transportation, logistics, and/or distribution operations related to our subsidiaries. Direct interaction is required with our Advanced Logistics Centers, Transportation carriers & Supply Chain vendors, IM-Logistics Sales and Program Management associates, as well as Ingram Micro suppliers and customers.
JOB DUTIES:
The position supports Logistics and Transportation management by conducting analyses and reporting on functions that are deemed necessary by the leadership team.
Project Management of assigned initiatives to completion.
The Transportation Analyst would independently identify opportunities and complete analytics within the supply chain with limited or no management direction.
The position would assist in developing plans of action by creating and/or compiling data or schedule; program, service and/or product recommendations as well as other financial or policy data.
Managing data that controls our Transportation Management Systems (TMS) is also potentially in scope depending upon the reporting assignment within the department.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree preferred, preferably in one of the disciplines of Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Logistics and/or Transportation OR 3 years of external related experience or 2 years of Ingram Micro related experience.
3-5+ years of related experience preferred, with a strong emphasis on practical Transportation and Supply Chain expertise.
Knowledge of: Supply Chain and Transportation functionality, Distribution Center Operations, transportation carrier documentation and processes, transportation modes, tariffs and rates, supplier collaboration, product distribution, and lead time optimization.
Skilled in MS Office applications & Business Intelligence reporting at an intermediate to advanced level, Transportation Management Systems, and Supply Chain KPI reporting.
Ability to: Analyze data and present alternatives for problem resolution and assist in implementation when appropriate, communicate cross functionally and externally with customer and vendors, balance priorities and have a recognition of risk and reward in the area that they are working.
Developed communication and interpersonal skills to include presentation skills are important, as this role involves collaborating across multiple departments to drive improvement.
Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

The candidate must be organized, detail oriented, possess the ability to prioritize workload, handle concurrent responsibilities and project tasks, and work individually and collaboratively in a team environment.
This is a fast-paced, multiple project environment; the qualified candidate must be able to balance multiple projects and tasks, manage to project deadlines and effectively and appropriately escalate and follow-up on issues and assignments. The successful candidate must be a demonstrated self-starter with an aptitude for learning and a desire to take on new responsibilities and challenges.
Responsibilities

Contributes to ongoing communication within IS and with business operations (e.g., user review meetings for milestone sign-off, obtaining user feedback, reporting on project status).

Participates in system test planning and execution including quality assurance and user acceptance test planning and execution
Coordinating and assisting in creation of user acceptance test plans and execution.
Participates in development of implementation schedules, system implementation planning and execution
Coordinating and assisting in creation of user training sessions and associated documentation.
Actively evaluates and resolves daily business problems by performing independent analysis
Participates in on-call rotation supporting production systems and user trouble reports
Participates in production deployment planning, execution and validation
Communicates task status/issues to IS management and project leaders
Participates in research and evaluation of appropriate software products being considered for acquisition
Participates in planning and execution of Disaster Recovery testing.
Leverage years of experience in supporting web sites to provide leadership and guidance on establishing best practices

 Mandatory skills
At least 5 years of experience as a business analyst working with Web based projects (eCommerce preferred)

Demonstrated experience gathering and documenting business requirements, participating in quality assurance and user acceptance testing

POSTION SUMMARY:
Our customer-centric team is changing the home lending game with fierce loyalty and a dedication to delivering an extraordinary home loan experience. We empower our team members by engaging and immersing them in a fun, positive, and energetic atmosphere that places emphasis on the customer experience above all else. If you love coming to work every day and winning, hold yourself to high goals and standards, subscribe to a no drama workplace and live to serve your customers as much as each other…we want you on our team.
Mission Loans is seeking mortgage and technology professionals who thrive in a fast-paced environment without losing focus on quality of work and delivering an exceptional customer experience. We operate in an agile promotion model that follows a consistent SDLC for development, promotion, testing, and deployments. We seek a candidate with prior mortgage experience that can support the very detailed and intricate updates required to maintain a compliant system, while maintaining a quality output, with a streamlined process. As an IT Business Analyst, your primary mission is to support the IT organization to define, develop, test and deploy business system solutions that enable the Mission Loans team to deliver a best-in-class customer experience.
PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

About usRestaurants and small businesses account for hundreds of billions of dollars in annual purchasing, yet most of it happens offline. From the humblest NYC slice and a cup of joe to museum-quality lattes (and yes, avocado toast), each order represents a long paper trail and a series of truck deliveries.With a rapidly growing market presence, Cheetah is already streamlining the daily workflow of hundreds of restaurants and small business owners. Using Cheetah’s services, they manage millions of dollars in monthly purchasing, while Cheetah eliminates the burden of costly sales reps and inflexible, inefficient distribution centers. Partnering with the largest suppliers in the US, Cheetah is bringing the Silicon Valley user experience to an industry that hasn’t evolved in decades. In the process, we’re helping to reintroduce the small business owner to the small farmer, global supply chains to familiar faces, and delivery and logistics workers to increased mobility and new opportunities.At Cheetah, a relentless executive team has set out to change this reality, armed with deep industry and entrepreneurial experience, personal conviction, and $70M in funding from Eclipse, Floodgate, and the early backers of Facebook, Lyft and Airbnb.Unencumbered by the old-school business models and practices, Cheetah has introduced unprecedented transparency in pricing and inventory to the SMB marketplace. In doing so, Cheetah allows the people who form the backbone of local economies to focus on what they love: cooking great food and providing excellent service. From the convenience of their phones, business owners can now order whatever they need, discover new, rare or seasonal specialty products, and prioritize their customers. No more rushing to unload your double-parked van, or waiting anxiously for a truck to show up with your weekly allotment of boxes.Pricing AnalystCheetah is looking for a data analyst with experience in pricing and promotion/ clearance. This function is vital to the long-term success of the company - you will ensure that Cheetah maintains competitive long-term pricing and develops short-term strategies to avoid waste.In this role, you will own and execute the company’s pricing policies, develop our promotion/clearance processes, and analyze the business impact of changes to upstream vendor costs or downstream customer-facing prices. Additionally, you will identify new opportunities and implement strategies to drive growth and profitability. You’ll work closely with a range of stakeholders, from Category Management to Procurement to executive management.Responsibilities: Execute key strategic and operational pricing initiatives, including volume-tiered pricing to drive rapid growthMaintain the pricing system and perform key functions including publishing prices and promotional discounts to the ERP.Work cross-functionally with Category Management, Procurement, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance to support pricing and strategy needs.Develop and expand pricing analytics; providing insights on trends in pricing KPIs, and automate reporting to share results.Provide detailed insight to stakeholders and create strategic plans to hit targets in key mature and growth markets.Track and forecast our costs by SKU and category, identifying anomalies and opportunities.Develop reporting around margins and cost inflation, improving our financial forecasting capabilities.Establish baseline metrics and reports to support the development of new practices.Qualifications: 3+ years of experience as a pricing analyst, economist, data analyst, business analyst, or a similar role.Proven track record in solving business problems using data-driven and scientific methodsExperience using SQL to access and analyze data. Strong data visualization skills are a plus.Strong speaking, writing, and presentation skills, as well as the ability to persuade, inspire, and motivate others.Must have the ability to summarize key insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.Benefits and Perks: Flexible working schedule / locationCompany happy hours, team building events, and intramural sports teamsUnlimited paid time offComprehensive medical/dental/vision insurance and commuter benefits401(k) plan and flexible spending benefitsThe opportunity to work alongside a visionary team during Cheetah’s rapid growth!Job Type: Full-timePay: $90,000.00 - $130,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):What is an example of an analytical problem that you solved that you are proud of? Blizzard Entertainment games don’t just begin with game ideas, or end once those games are released. A lot more goes into the creation of a Blizzard product than the work of developers—and we support our games for years after they’re in the hands of gamers world-wide.
Blizzard Entertainment is seeking a Data Analyst, Game Analytics to drive strategic analysis focused on identification, evaluation, and execution of opportunities to drive growth and operational excellence for our games.

The Office of Information Technology (OIT) is responsible for supporting the IT needs of UC Irvine faculty, students, and staff. Our mission is to provide information technology leadership, services, and innovative solutions to promote the research, education, and community service goals of the University. The OIT Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse team is responsible for the design, development, deployment, documentation, ongoing maintenance, and support of the enterprise data warehouse (EDW) and decision support for the campus. The EDW is the centerpiece of the campus reporting and analytics strategy, facilitating decision making at all levels.

Under the supervision of the Decision Support and Institutional Research IT, the BI/DW Platform Administrator (Tableau, Informatica, Cognos) provides Business Intelligence (BI) and Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) support to facilitate the campus Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse effort. This system is the centerpiece of the campus reporting and analytics strategy, facilitating decision making at all levels. The incumbent works in close collaboration with other members of the Bl/DWH team, other teams within OIT, and functional and project offices throughout the campus. The incumbent serves as an platform administrator of the Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse infrastructure, including but not limited to BI/reporting tools, ETL tools, and data virtualization services. Duties include planning, installation, configuration, securing, upgrading, maintaining, monitoring, troubleshooting, and documenting the platforms and technologies. The incumbent works closely with other OIT teams administering related technologies, including but not limited to the Windows Services Group, DBA Team, Middleware Team, and Security Team. The incumbent has detailed knowledge about the supported BI products, stays current with product roadmaps and new features, assess how new features can be adopted and best utilized within OIT, adopts new features to the BI infrastructure, and conducts outreach, communications and training related to the product. Other duties include responding to service requests and trouble tickets; managing the workflow of requests to the BI/DWH team, including dispatching work and following up; developing BI content as needed, including reports, dashboards, frameworks and cubes; and serving in a support and consultation role to constituents in OIT and throughout the campus who are developing BI content.

Compensation Range: Commensurate with experience

Department Website: http://www.oit.uci.edu

positionName: Senior Business Analyst, Appstore / Cross Screen Tech Experience
description:
5+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role
3+ years of experience conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
Proficient extracting and processing data using SQL
Experience in data visualization platforms
Self-driven, and able to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data.

Job summary
Are you passionate about working in the entertainment technology space that touches millions customers through apps and games? Do you love data and have a passion for technology? Do you want to work on a team that solves significant customer problems through innovative technology?

We are looking for a smart, analytical, excited and results-oriented Sr. Business Analyst to join the Appstore team. You will work directly with Product and Engineering, and also partner with Finance, Marketing and Business Development teams to analyze and develop insights that inform how we build new products and features while engaging and delighting current customers.

Key job responsibilities

Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format. Translate data into actionable insights
Analyze historical and segmentation data to identify trends and insights
Identify areas of opportunity to automate and scale ad-hoc analyses
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs.
Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions
Prepare and deliver reviews to the senior management teams on product/business analysis and recommended actions
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.

A day in the life
This role will be a key member of the Appstore Data Business Analysis team supporting our product, engineering, and business teams focused on finding insights to help build better products and services for our customers. You will be conducting data analysis across our various initiatives, coordinating across the multiple teams within Appstore and the Entertainment Devices and Services teams while synthesizing findings and recommendations for what we build next / how we improve.

About the team
Appstore obsesses about how to get apps and games from our development partners to our customers in the quickest, most seamless way possible while continually looking to improve on products and features across our own devices (Fire TV, Fire Tablets) and other third devices (Android). The product and engineering teams envision and build these products and features bringing them to life for our customers.


7+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role
Master’s Degree in Economics, Business Analytics, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics or related quantitative field or MBA with a concentration in Quantitative Analysis.
Experience in entertainment and software development is a plus.
Strong grasp of quantitative data analysis and statistics.
Demonstrated advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.
Passionate about contributing to the team growth

Company Description
Come deliver technology solutions that make Finance at Experian a world-class analytical and insights engine. The Digital Transformation team finds ways to help Finance craft data-driven stories at scale – influencing over $5B in annual revenues. We’re building a technology roadmap that starts with data visualization all the way to recommendations powered by artificial intelligence (AI). No Finance organization in the world has achieved this. Join us as a founding team member to identify areas ripe for technology disruption. You’ll play equal parts explorer, builder, and implementer. And you’ll be joining a group with diverse skills in data science, systems analysis, product management, software development, and data storytelling.
About Experian
We wrangle the world of data to help consumers, businesses, and society take control of their financial futures. For more than 125 years, we have gathered, analyzed, and processed data in ways others can’t – and we’re not done. We’ve unlock opportunities for clients in over 100 countries. And we’re on FORTUNE’s 100 best companies to work for and Forbes’ 100 most innovative companies.

Job Description
What you’ll do
Everything we do centers on one theme: how might we transform the Finance organization’s productivity by 10x? Whether evolutionary or revolutionary, we’re seeking solutions that sum up to be greater than its parts. Be ready to apply your product intuition, design thinking, and developer craft at various times.
Explore, design, and build various components of a business intelligence ecosystem – you’ll start with data visualization dashboards and basic algorithmic calculations to answer key business questions
Identify transformation opportunities by using mixed methods to lead cross-functional teams in tackling loosely defined problems with minimal supervision
Squash data silos by instrumenting (with engineering) data ingestion into our data lake
Maximize ROI on technology investments by creating and rolling out user testing and adoption strategies
Develop hypotheses and deliver data-driven recommendations to Finance VP and SVP stakeholders
Lend your expertise to bridge the gap between business requirements and tech capabilities – guiding process and systems decisions both big and small
Promote a culture of experimentation and metrics through supporting communities of practice

Qualifications

Position Summary:
Drive supply chain inventory efficiencies by providing analysis related to slow moving and obsolete inventory, identifying root cause, and developing corrective and preventative actions. Actively work to increase inventory turns while maintaining efficiently managed inventory. Work to identify inventory patterns and perform overall inventory analysis. Define and monitor metrics to identify anomalies, recurring issues, and trends and recommend corrective / preventative action. (25%)

APICS Certified a plus

It’s Time For A Change…
Your Future Evolves Here
At New Century Health we are pioneering a new era of specialty care, focused on engaging with payers and providers to improve the quality of care for patients diagnosed with cancer and heart disease. Our evidence-based care delivery model supports patients during their most vulnerable times, a responsibility we are both humbled by and passionate about.
With nearly two decades of proven results in Oncology and Cardiovascular care, New Century Health improves quality and lowers costs for the 6M+ patients whose care we manage. Our approach is based on a proven clinical model that engages Oncology and Cardiovascular specialists through value-based care delivery. We believe the highest quality care is also the lowest cost care over time, improving outcomes and delivering financial savings to our partners. The New Century Health model has been proven across Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial populations. New Century Health joined the Evolent Health family in 2018, joining the mission to change the health of the nation.
Are we growing? Absolutely. We have seen about 30% average growth over the last three years. Are we recognized? Definitely. We were named one of “Becker’s 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare” in 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019 and are proud to be recognized as a leader in driving diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) efforts. Evolent achieved a 100% score on the 2020 Human Rights Campaign's Corporate Equality Index, making us one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+ employees. We were also named on the Best Companies for Women to Advance List 2020 by Parity .org and we publish an annual Diversity Report to share our progress on how we’re building an equitable workplace and performing on various metrics. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it.
What You’ll Be Doing:
The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for the creation and documentation of business requirements, standard processes and operational workflows that improve efficiency through process reengineering and automation. The position will partner with internal and external Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to build detailed requirements and provide end-to-end analytical oversight during project life cycle. The incumbent will act as a dependable liaison between Information Technology (IT) and NCH business partners to interpret requirements, set expectations and conduct Joined Application Requirements gathering sessions (JARs). For larger initiatives the ideal candidate will be able to provide subject matter expertise about Healthcare Products and Implementations/Expansions for internal and external clients. Resource will have direct interaction with Senior Leadership and Operational Business Owners.
Serves as the main point of contact to document scope changes and obtain internal/external stakeholder approvals in relation to requirements.
Understands New Century Health (NCH) business and systems workflow to leverage existing capability for meeting business expectations.
Tracks requirements to the test cases during QA testing by reviewing results/approvals to ensure high quality of deliverables.
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, evaluating output requirements and formats.
Communicates directly with Implementation Management team to insure timely updates to the scope / requirements
Act as a liaison between IT and NCH business units by:
Providing clear definition of requirements and insuring complete understanding by technical team
Providing a single point of contact for business units into IT and acts as a conduit between the two organizations in relation to the scope and project’s requirements
Making recommendations for product enhancements
Participate in business process modeling sessions, acting as a documentarian, co-facilitator, facilitator or subject matter expert in sketch sessions.
Conduct interviews and perform analysis to create business cases for projects.
Conduct preliminary investigation for all project requests. Review requirements, specifications, test, support and training plans to ensure they are in line with business objectives on projects.
Participate in root cause analysis to recommend product enhancements or other appropriate actions to improve productivity for both the business units and IT.
May assist as a project coordinator with selected initiatives.
Coordinate training development and work with training staff for timely rollout of new product/process.
Provide subject matter expertise in healthcare processing and utilization management processes Claims processes expertise is desired but not required
Identifies process areas for improvement in collaboration with IT and business operations team. Uses fact base data analysis for sizing opportunity and recommends prioritization based on operations provided ROI (Return on Investment)
Conduct requirement gathering sessions with SMEs, document requirements, and builds prototype (as required) to obtain stakeholder sign-off.
Maintains regular and consistent attendance.
Performs other duties as needed.
The Experience You’ll Need (Required):
Bachelor’s degree in healthcare administration, information systems or a related field or equivalent work experience.
3+ years of business analyst experience
Ability to understand utilization management, healthcare claims processing and quickly grasp new technology. Must be able to learn the functionality of our products and services in a short time frame.
Possesses effective verbal/written communication skills, especially via phone, with the ability to interact with various levels of personnel.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, demonstrate excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and organizational skills.
Performs multiple tasks efficiently and accurately, have exceptional attention to detail and perform consistent work product validation/QA.
Self-motivated, self-directed, team oriented, and responsible, with a positive attitude and a proactive style. Possesses the ability to operate in a highly variable work environment.
Finishing Touches (Preferred):

Project Management experience
Experience in a managed care environment
Technical requirements:
Currently, Evolent employees work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19. As such, we require that all employees have the following technical capability at their home: High speed internet over 10 MBPS and, specifically for all call center employees, the ability to plug in directly to the home internet router. These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations.

Chancellor's Office Statement

Join our team at the California State University, Office of the Chancellor, and make a difference in providing access to higher education. We are currently seeking experienced candidates for the position of Info Tech Service Management (ITSM) Lead Analyst/Programmer . The CSU Chancellor's Office, located on the waterfront adjacent to the Aquarium of the Pacific in downtown Long Beach, is the headquarters for the nation's largest and most diverse system of higher education. The CSU Chancellor's Office offers a premium benefit package that includes outstanding vacation, health, and dental plans; a fee waiver education program; membership in the California Public Employees Retirement System (PERS); and 14 paid holidays a year.

Salary

The salary range for this classification is $6,249 to $12,100 per month.

Classification

Analyst/Programmer - Expert

Position Information

The California State University, Office of the Chancellor, is seeking an Info Tech Service Management (ITSM) Lead Analyst/Programmer to provide the lead support for the Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) applications (ServiceNow) and integration with other platforms. The position will also provide mobile-friendly web application development and support for customers at the Chancellor’s Office (CO) including determining requirements, designing, developing, and troubleshooting such applications. This position will work closely with customers to determine their needs, define technical requirements and provide solutions based upon business and technical requirements.

Responsibilities

Under the general direction of the Assistant Director, Productivity Services, the Info Tech Service Management (ITSM) Lead Analyst/Programmer will perform tasks and duties as follows:
Provide web/mobile application development and support to customers at the Chancellor’s Office as well as customers system-wide.
Participate in project planning and preparation including identifying business and technical requirements.
Design functionality based on business and technical requirements.
Attend project-planning meetings and provide input into planning and execution of the projects.
Install and test applications.
Provide training and guidance to secondary ITSM resources on basic and advanced system features, modules, and applications.
Provide training to customers to ensure effective use of the ITSM (ServiceNow) application.
Provide ongoing system administration for the ITSM (ServiceNow) application including monitoring, testing, quality assurance, upgrades, and patches.
Provide ongoing support for web and mobile applications including testing, quality assurance, upgrades, and patches.
Implement approved application changes per requests.
Troubleshoot and resolve all user web and mobile application problems.
Maintain an application delivery methodology.
Provide a test/development environment for web/mobile application upgrades, testing and implementation.
Work closely with technical staff to ensure project quality.
Manage web and mobile application security including user authorization, control over access, and other security measures.
Document all ITSM, mobile, and web applications including the code, the functionality, change management, and version control.
Consult with technical staff as needed.
Adhere to ITS security policies and guidelines in the daily performance of web and mobile application development and support activities.
The ITSM Lead Analyst/Programmer is also responsible for any other duties as assigned. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for keeping current in the industry, including technology changes, trends and best practices. The incumbent is also responsible for addressing any concerns regarding technical operations with the appropriate supervisor.

Qualifications

This position requires:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Five years of experience providing enterprise systems support for ITSM applications, business processes, workflows, and reporting.
Five years of experience providing application development and support.

Management and Organizational Skills
Ability to lead and mentor ITSM developers to ensure they follow best practices and guidelines.
Ability to prioritize projects and customer requests to meet deadlines.

Communication & People Skills
Excellent written communication skills are necessary to provide accurate technical documentation.
Supports an environment that motivates others and builds morale.
Works effectively and cooperatively with other team members to achieve goals and develop/maintain working relationships.
Ability to effectively communicate with various users.
Uses effective communication and listening skills in order to work with others and problem solve.
Ability to quickly gather information from and disseminate information to the appropriate parties.
Ability to conduct training sessions.

Analytical Skills
Ability to analyze business requirements and understand the structure, policies, and operations to recommend technical solutions that enable organizations to achieve their goals.
Ability to assist in trouble-shooting, including quickly identifying problems and acting appropriately.
Develops practical and thorough solutions to address all aspects of identified problems.
Identifies problems and uses appropriate sources to research technical problems.
Ability to independently apply technical judgment to standard applications and systems.

Project Management Skills
Ability to track and document information between multiple parties.
Experience in coordinating resource requirements.
Attention to detail and solid organizational skills are necessary.
Ability to schedule and prioritize in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently with little supervision.
Ability to coordinate with third party vendors without disrupting project flow.
Ability to multi-task and coordinate.

Technical Skills
Advanced knowledge and development experience with ITSM (ServiceNow/Remedy) applications is required.
Experience with Oracle/SQL Server RDBMS, UNIX, Windows Technology and Web Technology is required.
Experience in development and support of mobile-friendly web-based applications and systems integration is required.
Thorough working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and browsers including web page development and cross-browser operability required.
Skills in SQL, JavaScript, C#, .Net, ASPX, HTML, XML, CSS, CGI, and Java programming are required.
Professional experience with database design, architecting, and normalization required.
Ability to set up and configure web content management systems (SharePoint, WordPress) is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Productivity Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio) is required.

Preferred Qualifications
Professional experience developing web and mobile enabled data collection and reporting applications using Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL preferred.
Experience with RSS, podcasts and video streaming is preferred.

Application Period

Priority consideration will be given to candidates who apply by November 10, 2021. Applications will be accepted until the job posting is removed.

Responsible for a range of process improvement and process management activities. Activities include planning, performing, and implementing process improvement initiatives, in addition to ownership of operational processes. These initiatives may represent one portion of a larger project, or may represent a stand-alone initiative or function within a work group or department. Process management functions may include data gathering and analysis, best practice research, process mapping, developing and recommending alternatives for improvement, developing performance metrics, obtaining leadership or stakeholder agreement, implementing improvements, and monitoring post-process improvement initiative performance to updated standards. Activities are undertaken and executed in support of organizational goals and are accountable for providing business process solutions to meet internal and external customer expectations. May utilize Lean/Six Sigma processes and concepts to lead process improvement initiatives. Partners with management, project champions, and process owners to execute the project and deliver results.
Required Skills
Knowledge of data modelling and data visualization with Tableau software
Data Analysis: Identifies sources for, gathers and analyzes data relevant to processes. May review the work of less senior analysts/consultants. May be responsible for defining data requirements and obtaining customer agreements.
Research: Reviews best practice research prepared by less senior analysts/consultants. Makes recommendations on appropriate solutions based on research; may select from alternatives presented.
Process Architecture: Designs complex processes and reviews the work of less senior analysts/consultants. Ensures process mapping is complete; provides feedback and guidance to less senior analysts/consultants. Interviews stakeholders and process owners to define processes. Helps define standards and methods.
Process Recommendations: Determines process recommendation documents, including presentations, process maps, supporting metrics, business requirements and related impact analyses for complex processes or for portions of larger or inter-related processes. May lead the development of recommendations by less senior analysts/consultants. May apply Lean/Six Sigma concepts and techniques to process improvement initiatives, including completing Lean/Six Sigma analyses and tasks. Shares accountability for realization of results with process owners and may present recommendations to stakeholders and process owners.
Performance Management & Control: Defines, develops and evaluates performance metrics to establish process success, and may participate in working with multiple stakeholders, often with competing/conflicting objectives, to ensure cohesive and reachable measures of success. Reviews data post- implementation to measure success; participates in defining standards of improvement success.
Change Management: Participates in and may lead change management activities associated with process improvement. Engages leadership and stakeholders to obtain support and buy in for changes. Partners with management, project champions, and process owners to align process improvement initiatives with business objectives.
(For Six Sigma Black Belts): May track progress of Six Sigma Green Belt consultants and newly certified Black Belt Consultants in Lean/Six Sigma initiatives. Trains other employees in Lean/Six Sigma concepts and techniques. Coaches and mentor’s employees seeking Green Belt and Black Belt certification.

Required Experience
Required:

Bachelor’s degree
Minimum four (4) years of process improvement, management consulting, change management, or related business experience.
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or comparable system process improvement certification
Broad knowledge of process improvement methodologies.
Demonstrated knowledge of advanced Microsoft excel, Microsoft Access, SQL


Preferred:

Minimum nine (9) years of process improvement, consulting, or related business experience
Minimum 2 to 5 years of experience with Healthcare payers
Health care or insurance experience
Lean/Six Sigma Black Belt Certification
Graduate degree

The Market Analyst role supports our Medical Business product lines, and will be responsible to collect, analyze, and connect large volumes of data from multiple sources, extract insights, and identify opportunities to drive sales and improve profitability. This role is a key player in an organization's evolution from selling products to position solutions effectively within a given market segment; as such, it requires the ability to collaborate across a wide variety of functions/roles.

positionName: Cyber Fusion Managed Services Threat Intelligence Analyst
location: 695 Town Center Dr. Suite 1000, Costa Mesa, CA 92626
description:
Cyber Risk Fusion Threat Intelligence Analyst

Are you interested in improving the cyber and organizational risk profiles of leading companies? Do you want to be involved in delivering Fusion Managed / Security Operations Center (SOC) Services including identifying unauthorized activities and intrusions in their networks in real time? Are you excited about rapidly changing operational environments, learning what you need to get the job done, and producing accurate and timely results?

If yes, then Deloitte's Fusion Managed Services (FMS) team could be the place for you! Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping cyber initiatives today. Deloitte's FMS business is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Delivering our industry leading services requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated services provider in helping to transform the cyber security services marketplace.

Our team is client focused and mission driven. As a Cyber Risk Fusion Threat Intelligence Analyst in Deloitte's Fusion Managed Services, you'll work with our diverse teams of passionate professionals to help solve for some of today's toughest cybersecurity challenges to enable or clients to achieve business growth and manage risk.


Work you'll do


As a Fusion Threat Intelligence Analyst, you will assist our clients with identifying unauthorized activities and intrusions in their networks in real time as part of a team of engineers and analysts around the world who specialize in the tactics, tools and procedures used by cyber criminals. This position is primarily focused on APT actors and their activities. We're looking for an intel analyst with deep knowledge of Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) campaigns, TTPs and activities.

APTs-Focused, works within an interdisciplinary team that develops advanced analytical frameworks, tools and research methodologies in order to identify emerging cyber threats
Collect information used to analyze the political, economic, social, and behavioral aspects of malicious cyber activity
Contribute to cyber threat intelligence products for our clients
Research and monitor underground forums, chat channels, and, social media, the identification and analysis of security incidents using open source and internal sources to assess severity and identify responsible parties, including hacktivist groups and actors
Assist in producing a comprehensive operating picture and cyber security situational awareness
Work with various intelligence collection and reporting tools and frameworks to produce reports
Collect, process, catalog, and document information using an ALL-SOURCE approach and various technical and human means on cyber-security topics as required based on defined intelligence requirements
Respond to requests for ad-hoc reporting and research topics from management and analysts as required
Identify gaps in available intelligence information and engage with leadership on strategies to meet intelligence requirements through Intelligence collection processes
Quickly understand and deliver on company and customer requirements
Deal professionally with potentially offensive, profane, and obscene materials encountered during the course of investigations and research
Aid in and participate in daily, weekly, quarterly, and yearly production reporting for clients, partners, and internal teams
Adhere to internal operational security and other Deloitte policies

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree or higher in Threat Intelligence, Information Security, Information Technology, Computer Science, Math, or any other related area
2+ years of experience working in cyber intelligence, information security, incident response, red team operations, reverse engineering, or other technical cyber security roles
Extensive knowledge of Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) tactics, technics and procedures
Understanding of possible attack activities such as network probing/scanning, DDOS, malicious code activity, etc.
Understanding of basic networking protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP
Outstanding written and oral communication skills and the ability to prioritize work
Good understanding of global geopolitical dynamics and the ability to apply that knowledge to an information security context
Proven ability to understand and explain the behaviors of different types of complex organizations, from APT groups to clients
Proven ability to translate complex information sets into specific recommendations that can be actioned by customers to enhance their security posture
Familiarity with cyber threats, defenses, motivations and techniques
Experience with intelligence analysis tools, methods and the intelligence lifecycle
Experience distilling raw information into actionable and finished intelligence
Ability to write analytical information products
Ability to construct and analyze social network graphs
Travel up to 10-20% (While 10-20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred:

Outstanding written and oral communication skills and the ability to prioritize work
Knowledge of foreign languages is a plus (Russian, Farsi, Arabic, Mandarin, Korean)
Strong understanding of threat analysis and enterprise level, mitigation strategies
Working knowledge of how malicious code operates and how technical vulnerabilities are exploited
Knowledge of operating systems and networking technologies in general
Knowledge of databases, query design, and how to analyze data thus obtained
Knowledge of toolsets such as Confluence, Jira
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated to improve knowledge and skills
A strong desire to understand the what as well as the why and the how of security incidents

The team

Deloitte Advisory's Cyber Risk team helps complex organizations more confidently pursue their growth, innovation and performance agendas through proactive management of the associated cyber risks. Our professionals provide advisory and implementation services that integrate risk, regulatory, and technology skills to help clients transform their legacy programs into proactive Secure.Vigilant.Resilient.TM cyber risk programs. Join the team developing the future state of cyber risk solutions. Learn more about Deloitte Advisory's Cyber Risk Services practice.

positionName: Data & Analytics Manager, Integrated Care Delivery
location: 3800 Kilroy Airport Way, Long Beach, CA 90806
description:
About SCAN
As one of the nation’s largest not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans, serving more than 200,000 members in California, SCAN Health Plan has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping seniors healthy and independent for over 40 years. SCAN employees are passionate about what they do, and understand that success is based on achieving the mission. Employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. To learn more, visit scanhealthplan.com or follow us on social media: LinkedIn; Facebook; and Twitter.
The Job
Enable the SCAN Mobile Care Team (SMCT) to maximize quality, optimize operational efficiency, and uncover growth opportunities by establishing the team’s reporting and analytics function and drawing out insights from the data. As the SMCT business expert, partner with SCAN’s data technology teams to communicate requirements and deliver on SMCT’s data needs.
You Will
Serve as the SMCT business expert to SCAN’s data technology teams by building a deep understanding of SMCT’s data needs, communicating requirements, and providing input on solutions
Craft comprehensive reports and dashboards to support
Optimization of day to day clinical operations and sales operations
Analysis of clinical outcomes, clinical quality, and network quality
Measurement of partner and vendor performance
Discovery of growth and expansion opportunities
Other strategic needs as required
Create onboarding materials and train SMCT stakeholders on how to read and utilize reports and dashboards; remain available to the team for ad-hoc support
Collect and prioritize feedback from SMCT stakeholders to improve upon analytics and reporting, and troubleshoot as needed
Regularly review all reports and dashboards; call out important insights, connect insights to business impacts, and propose actionable strategies to SMCT stakeholders and leaders through quick updates and prepared presentations using storytelling and data visualizations.
Proactively identify new metrics SMCT should track for deeper, expanded insights
Run reports to support SMCT leadership’s ad-hoc needs, such as leadership presentations, financial planning, and performance reviews
Create a playbook for reporting & analytics for other new clinical delivery programs at SCAN
Other projects and duties, as assigned.
Your Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years experience in data, analytics and reporting around value-based healthcare models, care delivery operations, and/or CMS quality metrics
Execllent computer skills including Microsoft Office, SQL, and Tableau
Must be able to draw out business insights from data
Must be able to distill down complex analysis into easily digestible concepts
Must be able to create custom ad-hoc reports in Tableau using SQL
Strong interpersonal skills, including excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
To ensure a healthy and safe work environment, all SCAN employees will be required to be fully vaccinated by January 1, 2022. Generally, you are considered fully vaccinated 14 days after receiving the last dose, as recommended by the manufacturer, of a vaccine that has been authorized by the FDA for use in the United States, including vaccinations that have been approved pursuant to an Emergency Use Authorization. If fully vaccinated outside of the United States, the vaccination must be listed for emergency use by the World Health Organization (WHO). If you cannot receive the vaccine because of a disability/medical reason or sincerely-held religious belief, you may request an accommodation to this requirement by contacting COVID-19@scanhealthplan.com. Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccination here - https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html.
What's in it for you?
A competitive compensation and benefits program
An annual employee bonus program
Robust Wellness Program
Generous paid-time-off (PTO)
Ten paid holidays per year, plus 1 additional floating holiday
Excellent 403(b) Retirement Saving Plan with employer match
Robust employee recognition program
Tuition reimbursement
An opportunity to become part of a team that makes a difference to our members and our community every day!
We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!
At SCAN we believe that it is our business to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects our community through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
