Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

description:
Salary: $77k - 90k per year
Reference: 872729

job summary:

Great company culture, fulltime salaried position. What we're looking for:
Project analyst/BoM management experience gained in a US automotive OEM.
Experience with commercial PLM systems.
Evidence that you can work with complex data to create compelling data-driven stories that resonate with stakeholders.
Experience of managing, strengthening and broadening key client relationships.
Exceptional communication, presentation and business writing skills, including being able to liaise with manufacturing, technical and business contacts at our clients.
The passion, resilience and energy to drive change.


location: Irvine, California
job type: Permanent
salary: $77,000 - 90,000 per year
work hours: 8am to 4pm
education: Bachelors

responsibilities:

In the role of PDM (Bill of Materials) Analyst (various levels available from trainee to senior). If you have any level of experience as a BoM Analyst or in other roles supporting the technical elements of automotive/complex engineering product development processes, then we'd love to hear from you
What you'll do_
Delivers highly specialized engagements that scale quickly into full digital product implementation. We work alongside our clients (mostly on location) to understand their challenges, provide expert guidance, and follow this up with the technical know-how to put that guidance into action. As such, our analysts are empowered to manage their projects as best befits the challenges they face without getting bogged down in red tape and SOPs.
As a PDM Analyst, you will...
Work with a major electric vehicle manufacturer to deliver quality data and reporting.
Develop strong relationships and become a trusted advisor to clients, with a deep understanding of the challenges they face.
Work with a talented team of analysts and consultants to develop and implement solutions and value add propositions to address these challenges.
Identify opportunities for future service offerings and contribute to business development strategy.
Share knowledge and inspire the team, as we take on bigger, better and more impactful projects.
Be committed to personal growth and ongoing development, with one or more of QR's development pathways.
Some projects will be challenging, but they will always be rewarding, and you'll be surrounded by a team of great people who are willing to go the extra mile to help you grow, succeed or simply unwind.
Most days you'll be on-site and working hand in hand with clients and other QR team members with a major EV brand based in Irvine, California. While this means that most days are very busy, we always make time for team-building and having new and shared experiences. We also know how valuable downtime can be, and weekends and holidays are sacrosanct to us, so you'll always be home for Friday evenings.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Kelly Services has an outstanding opening with a global automotive company Torrance, CA.
Job Title: Data Privacy Compliance Analyst
Pay rate: $72/hr.
Roles and Responsibilities: Within the CX Division, the Data Privacy Governance (DPG) team serves as the hub for privacy compliance work across the Honda enterprise. The analyst(s) within the team will collaborate with business and project teams to collect and share information, identify compliance requirements, and develop compliant solutions. Extensive interaction with those teams, with IT personnel, and with the Honda legal teams is requires. The analyst will support the fulfillment of customer rights requests received under CA Consumer Privacy Act and other similar laws as they become effective.
Daily Tasks:
Support data privacy compliance within the organization including requirements writing, design, coordination, analysis and communicating.
Collaborate with business and project teams to develop compliance recommendations. Assist with the presentation of recommendations to our governance bodies.
Facilitation with internal stakeholders, IT partners, potential vendors (including selection process) in the promotion, support and maintenance of all initiatives related to data privacy compliance
Administer the monthly meetings between DPG and its “team of teams”
Stay up to date on data privacy regulations. Correlate with internal and external counsel, and DPG leadership to interpret new privacy laws and assess their impact on our business.
Create and maintain detailed records relating to data inventories, business requirements, process flows, presentations, meeting records, etc. to support the Honda data privacy program and its governance requirements.
Required Skills:
Must have Bachelor’s Degree or higher.
Must have data privacy experience (GDPR and CCPA)
Strong presentation and analysis skills.
The ability to work with team members from different levels (executive leadership to business analysts) and different business units across the enterprise (Sales, Service, Marketing, Finance, IT).
Project management and project scheduling.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications specifically Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams. Proficient in collaboration tools like SharePoint, Jira, etc.
Desired Skills:
Experience with digital tools in the consumer-facing space (website, marketing, analytics, etc.).
Familiarity with IT development processes and coordination.
Experience in an Agile work environment.
Experience in vendor selection through proposal (RFP) process.
Must Have Data Privacy Experience (GDPR and CCPA)
Education Required: BA/BS

Sr. CI Analyst – Manufacturing Analytics
The Sr. CI Analyst – Manufacturing Analytics is responsible for supporting Niagara Bottling plants and corporate teams through cleaning, manipulating, and conducting research on all distribution and warehouse (D&W) data, and applying this data to sophisticated analytics programs to drive decisions and support. Through leveraging key partnerships, and developing a deep understanding of the business this role is responsible for delivering solutions to various business problems and drive process optimization across all domestic and international manufacturing plants.
Essential Functions
Data Analysis:
Design, develop, and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly D&W performance reports that provide information used in the decision-making process of various initiatives/projects.
Provide analysis on D&W, procurement, inventory, financials, etc. in direct support of the technical services team and Niagara leadership team’s needs.
Develop data models to aid in better understanding the impact of manufacturing activities to Key Performance Indicators of the manufacturing sites.
Develop necessary D&W reporting and analyses for Plant sites and Plant regions.
Collaboratively and independently assist in the analysis of data through extracting and defining relevant information.
Work with Business stakeholders to identify value added analytical opportunities
Prepare timely reports to highlight discrepancies in a dataset and accordingly suggest business rules to manage them.
Leverage statistical modeling and mathematical methods for projects and deep dive analysis
Provide analytical expertise and develop data analysis tools to assist in understanding and solving business problems
Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice
D&W Data Reporting:
Build and maintain KPI reporting for production performance for our network of manufacturing facilities
Conduct ad-hoc analysis
Work with IT to recommend new technologies for analytics and data science
Work with IT teams as a liaison for all D&W data solutions
Build predictive cost reduction models for D&W projects and initiatives
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
4 Years – Experience in Field or similar distribution, warehousing or manufacturing environment
2 Years – Experience managing people/projects
 *experience may include a combination of work experience and education
Preferred Qualifications:
6 Years– Experience in Field or similar distribution, warehousing or manufacturing environment
4 Years – Experience managing people/projectsexperience may include a combination of work experience and education
Competencies
Experience with scripting languages - R, Python, SQL, etc.
Deep knowledge of SQL to extract and transform data from various databases into meaningful analyses and reports.
Experience in various enterprise resource solution tools such as Oracle ERP, Oracle EBS.
Experience in data visualization platforms e.g., Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, Cognos etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access)
Strong and proven analytical and strategic skills
Initiative and resourcefulness in completing work assignments with limited guidance.
Detail oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects and complete assignments quickly and accurately.
Ability to effectively communicate and interpret, concisely, data to all team member levels.
Working knowledge of statistical models that can be used on large data sets to infer useful information
Problem Solving - identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully
Ability to work independently, asking for direction when needed
Oral Communication - speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; demonstrates presentation skills.
Team Work - balances team and individual responsibilities; contributes to building a positive team spirit; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives.
Written Communication - writes clearly and informatively; presents numerical data effectively; able to read and interpret written information.

Bachelor's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar.)
Preferred:
Master's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar.)

Required: N/A

positionName: Information Technology - IT Data & Reporting Specialist
description:
A Information Technology - IT Data & Reporting Specialist job is available Irvine, CA, with Belcan. In this role, you will Assist EUS leaders/managers with organizing, controlling, and reporting project and operational activities by coordinating meetings, resources, equipment, and information as necessary.

Job Description:
This is what you"ll do:

Work closely with the IT End User Services (EUS) leadership team to create comprehensive action plan to define, track, monitor, report, analyze, and remediate operational metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Track, report, and present weekly/monthly/ad-hoc EUS and IT Infrastructure metrics to the leadership team and IT stakeholders
Assist EUS leaders/managers with organizing, controlling, and reporting project and operational activities by coordinating meetings, resources, equipment, and information as necessary
Develop, track, and report EUS weekly/monthly/quarterly service level agreements (SLA), Experience Level Agreements (XLA), KPIs and any other agreed metrics
Analyze metrics, design reports, develop dashboards and communicate the results to EUS leaders/managers, and provide suggestions based on the findings to improve Client end user experience
Develop and create data layout leveraging tables, graphs, charts, heat maps, and process flow diagrams
Develop Service Now dashboards as requested by the EUS/IT Infrastructure leadership
Rigorously and effectively examine large quantities of data and derive insights from the data sets
Develop and maintain reporting templates, standards, and procedures
Any other responsibilities as assigned by the EUS leaders/managers
Develop positive relationships with the business and other IT functions involved in downstream EUS processes
Look to improve all aspects of the End User Services metrics continually

This is what you"ll need:

6+ Years of experience with Project coordination, management reporting, and IT communication
Bachelor"s is required for this position
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Experience with: Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, Smartsheet, Advanced Microsoft Excel (macros), Service Now reporting, JIRA reporting, SQL queries, Document Management, and SharePoint
Strong understanding of the IT Infrastructure and IT End User Services (EUS) domains such as IT Service Desk, Desktop Support, End-User Computing (EUC), O365/Messaging services, Platform Engineering, Cloud Engineering, and Network Engineering services
The innovative mindset in creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful
Ability to manage time and prioritize reporting requirements to meet deadlines
Ability to handle conflict situations effectively, with a win-win mindset
Ability to work with internal and external stakeholders to get the work done within the matrix organization (leading by influence)
Attention to details even under pressure
Effective Communication - Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear message to different audiences. Fosters open communication with all stakeholders.
Portfolio Management Skills - Plans, prioritizes, sequences, and manages a portfolio of work to maximize delivery of business value
Ability to communicate at all levels within the organization - Business Stakeholders, Senior Managers, and C-Level Execs
Prioritization Skills - The ability to analyze support requests and prioritize them based on impact
Self-Starter - The ability to actively look for improvements and automation

Anything you would want the candidates to know from the suppliers about this role or Client? We are not looking just for a data reporting specialist. We are looking for someone that can bring the thought-leadership to the table by analyzing the data, metrics, KPIs, and SLA trends and provide recommendations to our leaders.

Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Data Quality Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Data Quality Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Data Quality Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Solicit and analyst customer feedback on model quality issues, and help translate these to prioritizations for future model development
Monitor and analyze Machine Learning models in production
Establish and maintain Service Level Agreements for Machine Learning products.
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience with technical data collection and 2+ years of overall experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Strong knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Significant Python scripting experience
Significant Experience with Excel
Experience with Data Modeling
Experience with version control software (e.g. Git)
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!
Inclusive benefits package offerings 401k plans and customizable benefits including dental, vision, medical, etc. for you and your dependents.
An innovative culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.
Company supported and employee-driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working on a hybrid schedule and philanthropy.
Learning and development programs to help advance your career and personal growth.
What we value
Wherever it leads, Whatever it takes! We believe in making the impossible possible!
Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!
Innovate, learn, lead- Knowledge and growth is never ending!
We believe in hiring nice people because anything is possible when you have the team's support.
Improving the lives around us- A smile could change the entire world.

Clear Capital is the premier provider of real estate valuation, analytics, and technology solutions. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

job summary:

Great company culture, fulltime salaried position. What we're looking for:
Project analyst/BoM management experience gained in a US automotive OEM.
Experience with commercial PLM systems.
Evidence that you can work with complex data to create compelling data-driven stories that resonate with stakeholders.
Experience of managing, strengthening and broadening key client relationships.
Exceptional communication, presentation and business writing skills, including being able to liaise with manufacturing, technical and business contacts at our clients.
The passion, resilience and energy to drive change.


location: Irvine, California
job type: Permanent
salary: $77,000 - 90,000 per year
work hours: 8am to 4pm
education: Bachelors

responsibilities:

In the role of PDM (Bill of Materials) Analyst (various levels available from trainee to senior). If you have any level of experience as a BoM Analyst or in other roles supporting the technical elements of automotive/complex engineering product development processes, then we'd love to hear from you
What you'll do_
Delivers highly specialized engagements that scale quickly into full digital product implementation. We work alongside our clients (mostly on location) to understand their challenges, provide expert guidance, and follow this up with the technical know-how to put that guidance into action. As such, our analysts are empowered to manage their projects as best befits the challenges they face without getting bogged down in red tape and SOPs.
As a PDM Analyst, you will...
Work with a major electric vehicle manufacturer to deliver quality data and reporting.
Develop strong relationships and become a trusted advisor to clients, with a deep understanding of the challenges they face.
Work with a talented team of analysts and consultants to develop and implement solutions and value add propositions to address these challenges.
Identify opportunities for future service offerings and contribute to business development strategy.
Share knowledge and inspire the team, as we take on bigger, better and more impactful projects.
Be committed to personal growth and ongoing development, with one or more of QR's development pathways.
Some projects will be challenging, but they will always be rewarding, and you'll be surrounded by a team of great people who are willing to go the extra mile to help you grow, succeed or simply unwind.
Most days you'll be on-site and working hand in hand with clients and other QR team members with a major EV brand based in Irvine, California. While this means that most days are very busy, we always make time for team-building and having new and shared experiences. We also know how valuable downtime can be, and weekends and holidays are sacrosanct to us, so you'll always be home for Friday evenings.

Sprout Mortgage's technology team is growing, and we are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, you'll work to develop custom built solutions for retail loan officer, wholesale, correspondent, and loan manufacturing systems inside a developing digital ecosystem for the mortgage industry. You must understand the needs of different user personas and be able to articulate these to various groups within the product team and business organization. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and help implement the deployment plan. You will be asked to wear many hats and be a front-line contributor in leading product development. You will be the voice of the business to the development team and answer any questions and provide clarification on requirements. If you do not know the answer, you will find out from the relevant party. We are looking for a Do-It-All Rockstar who is great at building relationships, someone who will go the extra mile, wants to help build market defining products, and grow to manage their own product(s) in the future.

Desired Skills & Experience

Required

3+ years of experience working as a business analyst, preferably with finance/mortgage knowledge.
Experience working with new product development, creation of various artifacts such as SRS, FS, Use Cases, Data Flows and Process Flows for specific features within a project release.
Ability to meet with various business/client partners to understand their needs and challenge.
Must be able to write clear and concise business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Capable of analyzing and documenting data transformations and logic that need to be built to support the exchange of information, both internal and external.
Competency in basic product smoke testing.
Experience working within standard Agile methodologies, including, but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban.
Lead process improvement with your business partners and identify bottlenecks.
Experience working with a distributed team.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or foreign equivalent required.

Preferred

Experience with EllieMae Encompass
Strong core Business Analysis skills in the areas of elicitation, requirements analysis, business process improvement, requirements modeling, gap analysis, functional decomposition and design, data modeling, rapid prototyping, and other techniques (Agile experience preferable).
Strong analytical skills with an understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Experience with JIRA or any other project management tool (bonus if you know Aha!).
Experience with Cloud Environments (i.e., AWS, Azure, and Google).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Learns quickly when facing new problems, enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and is willing to experiment and try anything to find solutions.
Ability to effectively manage and facilitate meetings.
Self-motivated, strong initiative, flexible and good time management skills
Good knowledge on Mortgage Rules & Regulations as well as mortgage related data.
Help with UAT Testing and Analysis of test results.

positionName: BOM - Bill Of Materials Product Data Analyst
description:
Salary: $77k - 90k per year
Reference: 872729

job summary:

Great company culture, fulltime salaried position. What we're looking for:
Project analyst/BoM management experience gained in a US automotive OEM.
Experience with commercial PLM systems.
Evidence that you can work with complex data to create compelling data-driven stories that resonate with stakeholders.
Experience of managing, strengthening and broadening key client relationships.
Exceptional communication, presentation and business writing skills, including being able to liaise with manufacturing, technical and business contacts at our clients.
The passion, resilience and energy to drive change.


location: Irvine, California
job type: Permanent
salary: $77,000 - 90,000 per year
work hours: 8am to 4pm
education: Bachelors

responsibilities:

In the role of PDM (Bill of Materials) Analyst (various levels available from trainee to senior). If you have any level of experience as a BoM Analyst or in other roles supporting the technical elements of automotive/complex engineering product development processes, then we'd love to hear from you
What you'll do_
Delivers highly specialized engagements that scale quickly into full digital product implementation. We work alongside our clients (mostly on location) to understand their challenges, provide expert guidance, and follow this up with the technical know-how to put that guidance into action. As such, our analysts are empowered to manage their projects as best befits the challenges they face without getting bogged down in red tape and SOPs.
As a PDM Analyst, you will...
Work with a major electric vehicle manufacturer to deliver quality data and reporting.
Develop strong relationships and become a trusted advisor to clients, with a deep understanding of the challenges they face.
Work with a talented team of analysts and consultants to develop and implement solutions and value add propositions to address these challenges.
Identify opportunities for future service offerings and contribute to business development strategy.
Share knowledge and inspire the team, as we take on bigger, better and more impactful projects.
Be committed to personal growth and ongoing development, with one or more of QR's development pathways.
Some projects will be challenging, but they will always be rewarding, and you'll be surrounded by a team of great people who are willing to go the extra mile to help you grow, succeed or simply unwind.
Most days you'll be on-site and working hand in hand with clients and other QR team members with a major EV brand based in Irvine, California. While this means that most days are very busy, we always make time for team-building and having new and shared experiences. We also know how valuable downtime can be, and weekends and holidays are sacrosanct to us, so you'll always be home for Friday evenings.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.
This job posting is not applicable in CO.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience

positionName: Information Technology - IT Data & Reporting Specialist
description:
A Information Technology - IT Data & Reporting Specialist job is available Irvine, CA, with Belcan. In this role, you will Assist EUS leaders/managers with organizing, controlling, and reporting project and operational activities by coordinating meetings, resources, equipment, and information as necessary.

Job Description:
This is what you"ll do:

Work closely with the IT End User Services (EUS) leadership team to create comprehensive action plan to define, track, monitor, report, analyze, and remediate operational metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Track, report, and present weekly/monthly/ad-hoc EUS and IT Infrastructure metrics to the leadership team and IT stakeholders
Assist EUS leaders/managers with organizing, controlling, and reporting project and operational activities by coordinating meetings, resources, equipment, and information as necessary
Develop, track, and report EUS weekly/monthly/quarterly service level agreements (SLA), Experience Level Agreements (XLA), KPIs and any other agreed metrics
Analyze metrics, design reports, develop dashboards and communicate the results to EUS leaders/managers, and provide suggestions based on the findings to improve Client end user experience
Develop and create data layout leveraging tables, graphs, charts, heat maps, and process flow diagrams
Develop Service Now dashboards as requested by the EUS/IT Infrastructure leadership
Rigorously and effectively examine large quantities of data and derive insights from the data sets
Develop and maintain reporting templates, standards, and procedures
Any other responsibilities as assigned by the EUS leaders/managers
Develop positive relationships with the business and other IT functions involved in downstream EUS processes
Look to improve all aspects of the End User Services metrics continually

This is what you"ll need:

6+ Years of experience with Project coordination, management reporting, and IT communication
Bachelor"s is required for this position
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Experience with: Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, Smartsheet, Advanced Microsoft Excel (macros), Service Now reporting, JIRA reporting, SQL queries, Document Management, and SharePoint
Strong understanding of the IT Infrastructure and IT End User Services (EUS) domains such as IT Service Desk, Desktop Support, End-User Computing (EUC), O365/Messaging services, Platform Engineering, Cloud Engineering, and Network Engineering services
The innovative mindset in creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful
Ability to manage time and prioritize reporting requirements to meet deadlines
Ability to handle conflict situations effectively, with a win-win mindset
Ability to work with internal and external stakeholders to get the work done within the matrix organization (leading by influence)
Attention to details even under pressure
Effective Communication - Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear message to different audiences. Fosters open communication with all stakeholders.
Portfolio Management Skills - Plans, prioritizes, sequences, and manages a portfolio of work to maximize delivery of business value
Ability to communicate at all levels within the organization - Business Stakeholders, Senior Managers, and C-Level Execs
Prioritization Skills - The ability to analyze support requests and prioritize them based on impact
Self-Starter - The ability to actively look for improvements and automation

Anything you would want the candidates to know from the suppliers about this role or Client? We are not looking just for a data reporting specialist. We are looking for someone that can bring the thought-leadership to the table by analyzing the data, metrics, KPIs, and SLA trends and provide recommendations to our leaders.

If you are interested in this role, please apply via the 'apply now' link provided. Belcan is a global supplier of engineering, technical recruiting, and IT services to customers in the aerospace, industrial, and government sectors. Belcan engineers better outcomes through adaptive and integrated services-from jet engines, airframe, and avionics to heavy vehicles, chemical processing, and cybersecurity. Belcan takes a partnering approach to provide customer-driven solutions that are flexible, scalable, and cost-effective. Our unique capabilities have led to continuous growth and success for nearly 60 years. We are a team-driven Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity.

Partner with internal business leaders to uncover opportunities and provide insights based on financial results vs targets

Five or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) within a financial services environment; preferred candidates will have mortgage experience

Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis

Proven proficiency with data query/data management tools (SQL, Tableau et al)

MBA or CFA preferred

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. Austin, Texas-based kwx is the holding company of Keller Williams Realty, the world’s largest real estate technology franchise by agent count. With more than 1,070 offices and 190,000 associates worldwide, Keller Williams is also No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States.

Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis

Our Purpose
At Majesco, we believe in connecting people and business to Insurance in ways that are Innovative, Hyper-Relevant, Compelling and Personal. We bring together the brightest minds to build the future of Insurance; a world where Insurance makes life and business easier, more connected and better protected.
All About the Role:
Majesco is seeking an experienced, client-facing Business Analyst to serve as a cornerstone to our clients by blending insurance domain knowledge with a thorough understanding of Majesco software solutions. The Business Analyst will be a key liaison between the Insurance carrier and the Majesco software development teams.
Assist clients in effectively gathering business requirements
Understand and analyze client’s documentation, identifying implications, issues, and risks
Maintain a Traceability Matrix for mapping the customer requirements to corresponding functions
Develop business rating requirements documentation from client specifications
Prioritize customer’s requirements throughout the release lifecycle
Analyze and evaluate existing and/or proposed insurance systems
Analyze underwriting and rating manuals to determine rating similarities and differences across states
Work with multiple stakeholders to support development of client’s core insurance software solution and business process
Create visual design diagrams for all audiences
Develop test plans & participate in the testing process to ensure high quality project deliverables
Review test cases created by the client
Interact with other team members and clients to ensure quality solution
Effortlessly communicate with the client to track and debug testing issues, resolve them, and perform regression testing.
Act a mentor to colleagues and the client; train customers on solutions provided
Support development of detailed requirements, user stories and functional design documents that can be referenced by global delivery staff, respond to their questions, and reconcile the functionality of their deliverables to these documents.
Perform gap analysis for new requirements in case of product implementation. Manage scope of work and support to project team in query resolution
Act as a product owner and represent the customer and the business in a scrum team
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of experience in strategic BA role for large scale projects in IT
Strong Property & Casualty domain experience and expertise on Policy administration systems
Knowledge of ISO/NCCI rating (manuals)
5+ years of experience in requirements gathering and management of Commercial Lines web-based applications (e.g. Worker’s Compensation and Commercial Auto & other LOB’s) or Personal Lines web-based applications (e.g. Personal Auto, Homeowners Insurance & other LOB’s)
Experienced in processes in SAFe methodology (Scaled Agile Framework)
Work Experience
Overall 10+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with at least 5+ years of experience in Property & Casualty commercial lines.
Business Travel and Physical Demands
This is a remote position, based in the US. Business travel of approximately 30% yearly is expected for this position once the threat of COVID subsides.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree or global equivalent required

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Info:

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.
About Legrand North and Central America
Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.
About Legrand’s Data Center Power and Control Division
Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design. This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.

Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Data Quality Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Data Quality Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Data Quality Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Solicit and analyst customer feedback on model quality issues, and help translate these to prioritizations for future model development
Monitor and analyze Machine Learning models in production
Establish and maintain Service Level Agreements for Machine Learning products.
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience with technical data collection and 2+ years of overall experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Strong knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Significant Python scripting experience
Significant Experience with Excel
Experience with Data Modeling
Experience with version control software (e.g. Git)
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!
Inclusive benefits package offerings 401k plans and customizable benefits including dental, vision, medical, etc. for you and your dependents.
An innovative culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.
Company supported and employee-driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working on a hybrid schedule and philanthropy.
Learning and development programs to help advance your career and personal growth.
What we value
Wherever it leads, Whatever it takes! We believe in making the impossible possible!
Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!
Innovate, learn, lead- Knowledge and growth is never ending!
We believe in hiring nice people because anything is possible when you have the team's support.
Improving the lives around us- A smile could change the entire world.
Be the most trusted, respected, and loved real estate valuation company in the world.
About Us
Clear Capital is the premier provider of real estate valuation, analytics, and technology solutions. Powered by its more than 45 years worth of information on nearly every U.S. metro, neighborhood, and property, Clear Capital’s solutions are trusted by community credit unions and billion-dollar financial institutions alike. Clear Capital is headquartered in Reno-Tahoe with a team of more than 700 nationwide, dedicated to going wherever it leads, and doing whatever it takes.
Clear Capital is an equal opportunity employer.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
