Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Info:

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.
About Legrand North and Central America
Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.
About Legrand’s Data Center Power and Control Division
Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design. For more information, visit raritan.com and servertech.com

Kwx is an integrated home experience company that seamlessly unites the KW ecosystem to keep the agent at the center of the homeownership journey.
Austin, Texas-based kwx is the holding company of Keller Williams Realty, the world’s largest real estate technology franchise by agent count. With more than 1,070 offices and 190,000 associates worldwide, Keller Williams is also No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States.
In 2020, Keller Williams initially began the formation of kwx, composed of Keller Williams, Keller Williams Worldwide, Keller Offers and Keller Home Financial Services, consisting of Keller Mortgage and Keller Covered.
Since 1983, the company has cultivated an agent-centric, technology-driven and education-based culture that rewards agents as stakeholders. For more information, visit kwx.kw.com.
We consider the health and safety of our team members to be of paramount importance. Therefore, the Company’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy applies to all team members who physically work in the Austin, TX or Dublin, OH offices. It does not apply to team members who are working remotely (unless they come into the Company’s offices, in which case, this policy applies).
Essential Job Functions and Basic Duties
Create & implement performance analytic reporting & analysis for supported business units
In conjunction with the business leaders develop a forecasting model & process that can be used for both short term/long term projections
Work with sales & operations teams to develop capacity planning models
Perform market research/business intelligence to ensure forecasts are accurate as well as identifying industry benchmarks
Identify and create process improvements for reporting and dashboards
Partner with internal business leaders to uncover opportunities and provide insights based on financial results vs targets
Present forecasts, variance analysis and commentary to key stakeholders
Assist in the development of a framework to analyze data that will result in automated reporting
Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills are required
Five or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) within a financial services environment; preferred candidates will have mortgage experience
Experience in building complex financial models, capacity planning and forecasting tools
Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis
Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
Proven proficiency with data query/data management tools (SQL, Tableau et al)
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field
MBA or CFA preferred
Kwx is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Kwx recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics disability, age, veteran status, or other protected status as required by applicable law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

Our Purpose
At Majesco, we believe in connecting people and business to Insurance in ways that are Innovative, Hyper-Relevant, Compelling and Personal. We bring together the brightest minds to build the future of Insurance; a world where Insurance makes life and business easier, more connected and better protected.
All About the Role:
Majesco is seeking an experienced, client-facing Business Analyst to serve as a cornerstone to our clients by blending insurance domain knowledge with a thorough understanding of Majesco software solutions. The Business Analyst will be a key liaison between the Insurance carrier and the Majesco software development teams.
Assist clients in effectively gathering business requirements
Understand and analyze client’s documentation, identifying implications, issues, and risks
Maintain a Traceability Matrix for mapping the customer requirements to corresponding functions
Develop business rating requirements documentation from client specifications
Prioritize customer’s requirements throughout the release lifecycle
Analyze and evaluate existing and/or proposed insurance systems
Analyze underwriting and rating manuals to determine rating similarities and differences across states
Work with multiple stakeholders to support development of client’s core insurance software solution and business process
Create visual design diagrams for all audiences
Develop test plans & participate in the testing process to ensure high quality project deliverables
Review test cases created by the client
Interact with other team members and clients to ensure quality solution
Effortlessly communicate with the client to track and debug testing issues, resolve them, and perform regression testing.
Act a mentor to colleagues and the client; train customers on solutions provided
Support development of detailed requirements, user stories and functional design documents that can be referenced by global delivery staff, respond to their questions, and reconcile the functionality of their deliverables to these documents.
Perform gap analysis for new requirements in case of product implementation. Manage scope of work and support to project team in query resolution
Act as a product owner and represent the customer and the business in a scrum team
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of experience in strategic BA role for large scale projects in IT
Strong Property & Casualty domain experience and expertise on Policy administration systems
Knowledge of ISO/NCCI rating (manuals)
5+ years of experience in requirements gathering and management of Commercial Lines web-based applications (e.g. Worker’s Compensation and Commercial Auto & other LOB’s) or Personal Lines web-based applications (e.g. Personal Auto, Homeowners Insurance & other LOB’s)
Experienced in processes in SAFe methodology (Scaled Agile Framework)
Work Experience
Overall 10+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with at least 5+ years of experience in Property & Casualty commercial lines.
Business Travel and Physical Demands
This is a remote position, based in the US. Business travel of approximately 30% yearly is expected for this position once the threat of COVID subsides.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree or global equivalent required

Our Customer is a global investment management firm focusing on active fixed income management. They manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies, and vehicles including fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds, and private equity.
We are seeking an Asset Information Analyst on a contract basis to help support our Customer’s business needs. The candidate will focus on creating new security masters while assisting the team on projects and inquiries. While this means that most days are very busy, we always make time for team-building and having new and shared experiences. Delivers highly specialized engagements that scale quickly into full digital product implementation. We work alongside our clients (mostly on location) to understand their challenges, provide expert guidance, and follow this up with the technical know-how to put that guidance into action. As such, our analysts are empowered to manage their projects as best befits the challenges they face without getting bogged down in red tape and SOPs.
As a PDM Analyst, you will...
Work with a major electric vehicle manufacturer to deliver quality data and reporting.
Develop strong relationships and become a trusted advisor to clients, with a deep understanding of the challenges they face.
Work with a talented team of analysts and consultants to develop and implement solutions and value add propositions to address these challenges.
Identify opportunities for future service offerings and contribute to business development strategy.
Share knowledge and inspire the team, as we take on bigger, better and more impactful projects.
Be committed to personal growth and ongoing development, with one or more of QR's development pathways.
Some projects will be challenging, but they will always be rewarding, and you'll be surrounded by a team of great people who are willing to go the extra mile to help you grow, succeed or simply unwind.
Most days you'll be on-site and working hand in hand with clients and other QR team members with a major EV brand based in Irvine, California. While this means that most days are very busy, we always make time for team-building and having new and shared experiences. We also know how valuable downtime can be, and weekends and holidays are sacrosanct to us, so you'll always be home for Friday evenings.

Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.

As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.

We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Summary:
The E-commerce Business Analyst will work with the digital solutions group and support our company's eCommerce, marketing, and business operations strategies. Seeking a motivated Business Analyst to help drive our e-Commerce and content platforms, by helping to define a solid foundation of business and functional requirements.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
The Business Analyst will collaborate and interact with every team in the company from technical to business-oriented departments to ensure efficient delivery of technology projects.
Will be responsible for gathering, eliciting, documenting, and communicating business requirements in clear, detailed user stories or use cases, and translating into functional requirements.
Ensure that IT solutions are developed, tested and implemented to satisfy business requirements.
The position requires a high degree of practical business knowledge, creativity, and a team-oriented collaborative mindset.
Qualifications:
B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Math, or other related fields or equivalent job experience
7+ years business analysis experience, gathering requirements and documenting process flows for distributed applications in a SDLC environment
Strong knowledge of business analysis, best practices, and methodologies, including the ability to perform requirements tracing, QA validation, and user acceptance testing
Skilled in requirements gathering and documenting techniques including user requirement functional definitions, process flows, screen mock-ups, and business gap analysis
Analyze, scope, and effectively prioritize product backlog
Expert in breaking down problems into development tasks / user stories
Knowledge of full lifecycle software development
Knowledge with mobile iOS development and eCommerce preferably in multi-level marketing industry
Must have solid Agile/Scrum experience
Practical experience documenting requirements for the implementation of a CRM system. CRM configuration experience a plus.
Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment
Ability to deliver informative and structured presentations to business units and executive teams
Assists in the facilitation of team, product or business meetings
Excellent English verbal and written communication, with an ability to express business concepts in technical terms, and complex technical solutions in business terms
Ability to work independently with limited supervision

Our Customer is a global investment management firm focusing on active fixed income management. They manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies, and vehicles including fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds, and private equity.
We are seeking an Asset Information Analyst on a contract basis to help support our Customer’s business needs. The candidate will focus on creating new security masters while assisting the team on projects and inquiries. The Asset Information team has exposure to all the products that our client trades so candidates will need to learn the mechanics of the instruments, how the data is stored throughout our internal systems and how end-users are consuming the information. The position requires frequent interaction with teams throughout the organization including Legal, Compliance, Technology, Analytics, Risk, Account, and Portfolio Management. A strong technical background is required along with a solid understanding of the financial markets.
***This role will be remote while COVID restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at our Customer’s Newport Beach, CA office once it is determined safe to do so.***

What You’ll Do:
Create and maintain security master information

Monitor daily quality assurance checks

Reference data analysis and ad hoc projects

Answer data related inquiries for various departments throughout the organization

Submit system enhancements and work with technology teams to implement

Must Haves:
Previous reference data experience and knowledge of the financial markets

Consistently produce accurate, high-quality results with strong attention to detail

Ability to meet tight deadlines while managing several projects simultaneously

Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment

Strong technology skills, including proficiency in MS Excel and SQL

Education:
Bachelors degree - preferably in economics or finance

MBA, CFA, or active status in either program is a plus

Hours & Location:
M-F, 40 hours/week. This role will be remote while COVID restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at our Customer’s Newport Beach, CA office once it is determined safe to do so.
Please Note: In order to create a safe, productive work environment, our client is requiring all contractors who plan to be onsite to be fully vaccinated according to the CDC guidelines. Prior to coming into our offices, contractors will be required to attest that they are fully vaccinated.
Perks are available through our 3rd Party Employer of Record
Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life (including spouse & child), 401k, STD/LTD, AD&D, and Commuter Benefits program.

BHI Energy | Staffing Solutions (SSG) is searching for qualified candidates on behalf of one of our key clients for their open position of Sr. Financial Analyst located in San Clemente, CA
Sr. Financial Analyst
Performs research and analyses to support the effective utilization and treatment of the Company's financial assets. Develops recommendations on long and short-term investment and borrowing strategies, investment of pension and decommissioning trust funds, and risk management Devises pricing, capital and O&M expenditure, and capital recovery strategies to achieve Corporate financial goals. Develops models to forecast business conditions and to support Corporate and departmental decision making. Reviews and assesses impacts of changing regulations. Develops and analyzes data and writes compelling testimony and responses to regulatory agencies in support of rate, regulatory, and demand side management activities in compliance with regulatory requirements.



Bachelor's degree or higher in Business, Finance, Economics or related field.
Experience performing, developing, and implementing short-term and long-term financial analysis, financial planning and/or capital forecasting.
Master of Business Administration or Finance or Strategy.
CFA certification.


About BHI Energy

BHI Energy is a broad umbrella organization with a complete service offering that covers all facets of Power Generation through the entire Electrical Delivery system. For over 40 years, our diverse services have been focused on multiple end markets, united by our level of service and quality, our unique partnership approach to our customer relationships, and our internal culture of how we interact with and support each other. To learn more about us, go to www.bhienergy.com.

BHI Energy provides competitive compensation & benefits, career advancement opportunities and a great work culture!

Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Our client in the Insurance industry is currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst II.

The Business Systems Analyst II will be responsible for creating business process modeling, design, and workflow automation of the company documentation process.

Duration: 6 Month Project (potential for extension)
Hourly Rate: $50 - $55/hr. - W2 Only (Not open to C2C)
Location: Remote

Responsibilities:
Works with the business to drive the evaluation of new business ideas, vendors, and business models across the domain.
Proactively identifies gaps and provides options to address new and current systems, processes, and procedures in a cost-effective manner.
Collaborates with business across multiple segments to find opportunities for business improvements and leads efforts to translate those objectives into solutions.
Conducts analysis to determine the best path for solving business problems/opportunities that may include business models, process improvements, system enhancements, user training, and/or software procurement.
Provides an overview of scope for ongoing large business initiatives to help identify dependencies and trends.
Consults with Stakeholders and Delivery teams to identify and structure programs and projects that evolve and enhance prioritized capabilities.
Provides oversight and alignment between impacted parties by project scope and identifies alternatives to deliver both the solution and the value expected from the effort.
Creates scope backlogs that can be translated into a list of work.
Process Stewardship
Develops integrated business models to demonstrate interoperability between products, operations, and systems
Uses best practices and industry-standard techniques.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 5+ years as a Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst or Systems Analyst.
 Broad and deep knowledge of life insurance products, services, markets, and technology across the business value chain, or a defined domain segment.
Extensive experience in supporting the planning and deployment of process and technology initiatives.
Bachelor's or master's degree in MIS, Computer Science, Finance, or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Experience with Appian is a plus (or similar))

positionName: Agile Sr. Product Analyst - Mortgage Servicing/Data/Document Management/CRM
description:
We are at the forefront of change in this rapidly evolving lending market. mello, the Greek word for future, is our proprietary technology product that will transform & streamline the home buying process into a digital experience like no other competitor offers. But mello is just the beginning loanDepot will continue to invest in developing our own advanced technology ecosystem built around serving our customers & enabling our valued employees to provide exceptional service. Come join us!
Position Summary:
TheSenior Business System Analyst (BSA)will work closely with business units to gain in-depth understanding of Mortgage Servicing strategies, processes, roadmaps and the context in which the business and IT operates and interacts with all stakeholders. The Senior BSA is responsible for delivering quality products by understanding end user needs, developing detailed requirements, writing user stories, supporting technical designs and process improvement. The candidate will work with various stakeholders to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate business/user requirements. The senior BSA will help translate these business needs and end-user requirements into functional specifications which are captured in User Stories that describe what the system, process or service must do to fulfill the requirements.
Responsibilities:
Lead Agile Scrum meetings involving the business, management, IT and senior leadership
Ensure User Stories meet the definition of ready
Perform complex business analysis and requirements gathering through the facilitation of joint application design (JAD) sessions with both business and technology stakeholders
Write detailed specifications of requested system changes
Write data specifications, release notes, user guides and other deliverables as needed
Assist with creation & refinement of design (mockup) on new functionality
Develop and execute data mapping plans for conversions, migrations and system integrations
Suggest software and process improvements
Write queries to analyze business data to assist in decision making and ad hoc reporting
Able to follow a formal software development life cycle (SDLC) process to develop software
Use common techniques and tools for data modeling, UI design, and process flow diagramming
Use common techniques and tools for modeling system diagrams, processes, and interfaces
Work with Product owner to Build and maintain the Product Backlog and Product Roadmap
Requirements:

Bachelors Degree preferred.
Minimum of 5+ years experience in Agile Sr. BSA or similar role.
Experience in the Mortgage Servicing industry preferred.
Familiarity with BKFS Mortgage Servicing Platform (MSP) a plus.
Preferred Domain Knowledge: Performing and Non-performing (Default) Servicing, Payment Processing, CRM, Customer Service, Contact Center, IVR, Document Management, Servicing Data, B2C, Web, Portal.
Agile Experience: Experience operating in an agile environment. This includes: story writing, backlog management, functional decomposition, working with a product owner and managing the Product Roadmap.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with excellent meeting facilitation skills to effectively lead Agile Scrum ceremonies such as Sprint Reviews, Story Refinement sessions, and Feature Discovery sessions.
Basic Systems Understanding: Comfortable performing basic technical tasks using SQL, Azure DevOps, and MS Office. Critical thinker, able tolearn quickly, converse confidently with business partners, gather requirements, and suggest solution options.
Key Competencies/Behaviors: Self Starter, proactive, organized, collaborative, professional presence (can lead meetings confidently), high emotional intelligence (works well with others), thinks strategically and not just tactically.
The Perks:

Competitive compensation reliant on ability & experience.
Excellent benefits package including multiple health, dental & vision options.
Company paid life and AD&D Insurance, as well as additional voluntary benefit possibilities.
401K with robust company match.
DTO (Discretionary Time Off) in addition to 8 paid company holidays.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
